storyInfo: Mudrock brings the team to Kazdel only to find the whole team under attack by mysterious casters. To press onward, or look back into the abyss? They must make a choice.

attributes.content: Bob, how have you been?
I received your letter. I’m happy to hear you made it to Columbia safely.
We’re all doing well enough. At the least, we’re all alive.
Chainsmoke still wants to arm wrestle you, just once, and win. Chef remembers your bounty hunters owe him three gold coins.
It might be a little late by the time the Messenger reaches Columbia, but even so, I wanted to congratulate you.
I’m glad you could escape it all, Bob. Really.
I still remember your invitation. I’m very grateful you still remember us Sarkaz.
But—
Run! Mudrock!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Run, to Kazdel, to somewhere you can survive...!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: No... No, don’t say that, don’t...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Mudrock—!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: And never... never look back!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: L... Leave me, run! Run far, until Kazdel, until you... reach... Kazdel...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Chainsmoke...! Chain...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Let... let’s go. Hurry.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: But it’s hard to say we’re doing well.
After parting with you, we headed for Leithania.
We’ve gone through a lot. One mortifying thing is we’re called 'Mudrock Squad' now.
You know I don’t like to show myself. But the Infected in Leithania needed help. They needed to be saved.
I couldn’t leave them to their fates, Bob. Just like you’d never leave your bounty hunter brothers behind.
Why, why haven’t the scouts reported back yet?
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: Not them too, right...?
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: ...Don’t panic.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: The fog in this forest’s thick. They wouldn’t find us again so easily...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: But, but it’s been eight days, already!
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: And we’ve lost twelve of our own! We don’t even know who it is hunting us!
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: Don’t be too hard on anyone... Against enemies like these, it’s only natural to panic. It’s only right.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Mudrock?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: ...The one thing we can be sure is that they’re casters.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: My friends can be my eyes, but that’s all. No way to seize their silhouettes in this fog.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: But it’s been non-stop fireballs, hailstones and hurricanes! They’ve been right by us all this time, they’ve... wait!
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: What if this days-long fog is their Arts as well? This isn’t normal weather...! If they can make eyes of fire dance in the sky, they can—
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: Calm down.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: We’re leaning on the back foot, though. That’s a fact.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: We have no clue about their identity, their numbers, or how they’re even tracking us.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: The moment we leave an opening, someone gets attacked. This is some messed-up exotic guerilla warfare.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: ...Do Leithanien casters do this? If so, it’s news to me...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: I... I don’t know... I’ve never known casters like this...
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: And if the Captain’s tremendous gift for Arts... if the Captain can’t do anything, what can we do...?
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: ...What do we do?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: If we keep pressing forward like we planned, I don’t know even how many attacks we’ll take before we’re out of this forest—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: But if we wanted to fight back, we’d be fighting unknown foes in horrible visibility and falling temperatures.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: ...Take two of us to secure our route ahead. Keep within 500m of us. Report back every minute.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: I’ll watch the rear personally.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: No guarantees they’re to our 'rear'.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: My friends will guard the main group.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: ...Fine. But don’t go heavy with your Arts.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: We can’t risk you of all people falling.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: I understand that... Thank you.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Mudrock?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: ...Swear to me one thing, Chef.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: So long as you’re in contact with the main group, keep leading them forward.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Ignore whatever happens behind you... never look back.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Bob. What kind of place is Columbia?
I’ve heard that the Infected are allowed a life so long as they work. They form the low-cost workforce she needs to serve her limitless expansion, and nothing more.
Even so, I guess you’re all very suited to the work? Is your farm big? Are the wheat fields swept in the autumn winds as beautiful as the movies say?
Though it’s hard to admit, I’ve never seen real hops for myself.
I’ve asked a lot of people, and I’ve even sought out books on botany... so I have an idea of what hops flowers look like.
If I find my own calm corner of the world to live in, I’ll write to you from there. If I do, could you send me a small sample in return?
What’s happening!? What’s going on!?
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: My skin... the crystals are moving, they’re moving inside me—I—my—gaaahh—
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: They’re... they’re trying to use the Infected as Arts Units...?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: They couldn’t... they can’t! Where the hell are the casters? These Arts... how could someone manage to do this!?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Where’s Mudrock!? Is Mudrock still there!?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Are you okay?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Gasp... keep... your distance!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: They’re nearby, I can feel it, it’s like witchcraft... No modern Arts are like this...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: They’re using... the Originium—ghhak—inside the Infected...!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Snap out of it!
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Boulders, find my enemy—!
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Don’t... don’t waste the energy, Mudrock!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: You’re still... far from returning to the fertile land... You need to live on!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: No—!
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Your hand! The crystals, piercing your skin... I need to...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Hah-hah... the imagination they must have to 'use' Infected like this... Those hatted casters... they’re terrifying.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: ...Mudrock.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: —I’m here.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Take the rest of us, and live... to return to Kazdel. Yes—to return to our home—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Hah, our home...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Didn’t we know deep down... we had nothing, wherever we went. As long we can live on, who cares where we go?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Grhk—Like hell I’d let my life be their weapon! Tell all the others—I died fighting!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Wait...!
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: You... Why...? No warrior’s end should be by his own hands...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: —Come out here!
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Come out, right now—!
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Rock echoes the wrathful Sarkaz. The colossus stands tall. Stands as if a monument to the deceased.
The frigid wind howls through the forest.
Figures seem to stand in the far distance. Or perhaps they are only broken, shuddering tree trunks.
The colossus flies forth for them.
Bob. Sorry for rambling on like this.
We’ve departed Leithania. To return to Kazdel.
The journey is long. It may be dangerous. In the short time we had, I could not find a Messenger to take this letter for me.
If we can make it to Kazdel safely, and the Infected who’ve come with us can settle down—
—Afterwards, I might pay a visit to Columbia to see you.
Mudrock, you’re okay! The others...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Goddamn it...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: We left a single forest. It cost half of us to do so...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: ...Mudrock.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Can we fight back?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Our group... has so many civilians, still. We can’t...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: ...Mudrock?
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: Ah... Is something wrong?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Our pursuers... There might... be something we know about them.
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: Them, their Originium Arts... taking Infected lives as toys...
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: This sort of thing... should have long since faded into the past... but a few nobles research it, still...
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: They must be attendants of the towers, or Arts researchers... damn them, damn them...
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: ...As long as they’re not 'Knights,' worse has not yet come to worst.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Don’t worry... At the very least, for now... we’ve escaped them.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: The way back to Kazdel... is a long, long one.
So long that I’ve forgotten how my homeland looks.
Kazdel is a desolate barren. Still, some wanderers have taken to the old ruins of bygone wars. Founded towns you could call prosperous.
Resplendent cities the Sarkaz had never been allowed to have. But I’m only asking for somewhere quiet. A place to catch my breath for a while, in the middle of this age-old conflict.
...Past this mountain, we’ll be in Kazdel...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: From the top, we should see a great bridge, and past the river... a hundred kilometers north, a village where outsiders have settled.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: ...Is that where we’re headed?
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: Yes...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: I once... lived there.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Mudrock, we’ve finished securing our route ahead. No sign of any pursuers.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Good...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Let’s move. We’ll pitch our camp on the other side of the river before sundown.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: ...Mudrock!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Twenty-odd of our mercenaries got attacked by that lot! We never even so much as saw their faces!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: ...We can’t fight them. Too dangerous... Would you send your people to die like that?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: We-We’re sorry... we just...
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: No... I wasn’t saying to... *Sigh*.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Move. Don’t look back.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: I’ll keep the rear.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Mudrock?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Ah... sorry. I fell asleep...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: You’re exhausted.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: You haven’t given your Arts any rest since the attack.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: I’ll be fine.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: *Sigh* No-one can change your mind, I’ve learned that much.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: ...You know, I’m beginning to miss the good old days, when we were fighting Leithaniens we could actually see.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: The Gendarmerie, the armed guards, the militiamen. Hell, even the caster regiments...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: We did everything we could to avoid conflict with them... After all, they didn’t want to risk going down with us.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: But ever since last month, things changed.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: ...Mudrock, promise not to laugh at me, but I'm a little scared.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: ...Casters cloaking their true colors. Fearful Arts. Completely unable to protect ourselves. Where’s the shame in being afraid?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Yeah. You’re not wrong, for sure.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: ...If, and this is only hypothetical, if they were still behind us even now... or suppose they’re on the other side of the bridge. What then?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Would we have to fight? Or—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Casters, with few exceptions, are frail. We are many and strong. They know that all too well... their Arts are strange, and powerful...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: But the strongest caster is still a human. Don’t be afraid.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: They kept pace with our march in the forest. For a whole month, we never found any of their camps, never found any of their supply convoys, never even found a single trace of their movements...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Only lone teams, one after another, failing to returning contact.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Turning Infected into Arts Units... it’s possible, but the concept itself... no, even the raw difficulty would be far too...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Ah, I see... they’re experimenting.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: We’re the perfect test subjects. An inexhaustible supply of them.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: From their point of view, that is... all we are.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: ...Then who the hell are they?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Good question...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Past here, we should see the village in the basin.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: The final stretch... and then we’ll be...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Wait until the scouts come back... See how things are in the village.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Maybe this is where... we can start thinking about life afterwards.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Life afterwards? We can... finally call an end to our flight...?
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: ...Now we lay down our weapons and begin anew?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: What kind of life to live, I wonder...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Mudrock? Where are you going?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Hm... To take a look from the hilltop.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Alright. Stay in contact. We can set off at any time.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Before I left for Leithania, I had been putting off the question.
Was returning to Kazdel truly right? Can a new life happen just like that?
What I witnessed in Leithania taught me many things.
There are times when fate, destiny and such become a simple excuse. A byword for all of life’s unchanging paths.
I only want to live on... I want us all to live on.
Kazdel’s villages... are more prosperous than before.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Cooking smoke. Wagons. Markets.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: How long has it been since I last saw—hm?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Yet some things—
—you cannot run from.
Are these...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: ...bones?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Mudrock.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: There’s fog again... I don’t know if it’s just the fog of morning in the mountains, or...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: But either way, everyone’s shaken. We need you to calm us all down.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Mm—
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Yes. I can barely see the village from here anymore... fog has come.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Wait until the scouts return. Then come to me here.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: We’re all here.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: ...Do me a favor.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: What are...? Are these someone’s bones? Sarkaz remains?
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: They were small... Probably a child.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Here. It’s a broken knife. Rusted. This child might’ve died in battle.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Mm... help me bury them, at least.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: You could use your Arts to...
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: I want... to do it with my own hands.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: So lend yours too.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Ah. Okay...
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: ...Everybody. In front of us is a new life.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: We’ve made it back.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: A lot of our people sacrificed themselves for this.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Did we lose them?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: ...I don’t know.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: How’s the village?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: If I had to say, it’s bustling with life.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: There’s a good few Caprinae, not to mention a decent amount of Sami people.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: They’ve got a marketplace.  Some plots of land up for sale in there.  It’s an old Sarkaz who used to be a mercenary, managing those. Should be able to 'get along.'
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: I see... Wonderful.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: We’re very close to the village now. From here to there, we should have no trouble...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: So go and find your new lives.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: ...Er, Mudrock? What about all of you?
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: ...We need to stay here. See this through to the end.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Yeah... about time we did some mercenary work.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Wait...! You mean...
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: Go.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Don’t look back.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: You—You brought us all this way back to your homeland, just to get yourselves killed now...!?
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: ...He’s right. I’m just in it to help a bunch of old bastards get one over. You’re still young. Now’s the time to go.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Huh? You want me to run? I’d have to twist my own damn head off for you to kick if I wanted to look back.
attributes.name: Young Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: But we can’t just—
attributes.name: Leithanien Infected

attributes.content: ...We won’t look back. All who want to leave, can leave now.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: There’s no shame in it. There’s no need to blame yourself... We will protect this bridge.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: ...Supposing this is all a false alarm, and they’ve long given up, we’ll see you in town.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Warriors. Line up. Eyes forward.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: We defend this bridge to the death.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: What makes us think we can escape our cruel fate without a scratch?
Do we have the right to? Do we have the capacity to?
We can’t escape it, any of us. In the end, we all have to raise our weapons and confront the present we built with our past.
...How many have stayed?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Why don’t you look back for yourself and see?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: I... I’m just a little worried...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Seriously, you... alright, someone else, then. Hey. Count how many there are for Mudrock.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Don’t mess with me, alright? Didn’t I tell you I’d have to twist my head off to look back?
attributes.name: Young Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: ...You can tell just by the sound of it. Not that many even left.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: ...Thank you.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Really... thank you.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: The fog’s getting thicker... Captain, should we still keep an eye on them?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Guard

attributes.content: Those casters with the tall hats seriously made me want to throw up... they used the Infected slaves they had with them as their... their staves.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Guard

attributes.content: ...It looks like the Reunion bunch are readying for their last stand. What should we do?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Guard

attributes.options: Imagine, the Twin Empresses ascending the throne. It’s been decades since the Witch King passed—;—Leithania still hosts lunatics who mire themselves in the Witch King’s shadow.

attributes.content: Err... Captain, this stuff you talk about always flies over my head. Couldn’t you say things a little simpler?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Guard

attributes.content: Hold on, Captain, where are you going?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Guard

attributes.content: Whoa, that’s simple alright... But saving Reunion?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Guard

attributes.options: I only see a group of Sarkaz defending the Infected to the end.;From Casters desecrating life on the whims of rotten nobles.

attributes.content: But you said they were all super powerful, right?! At least wait until our team’s all together before—
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Guard

attributes.options: They’re no knights and garner no art’s favor. They’re jesters who flaunt witchcraft about.
Rhodes Island does not permit the desecration of Infected lives.

attributes.content: —Someone’s coming.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Ready!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: —Hold on!
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Wa—Wait, what did they... do?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: That was a single push... and Mudrock’s Colossus just...?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: ...Don’t engage! Fall back!
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: That’s... That’s a Sarkaz...! And...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.options: I’ve heard of you, in Operator Folinic’s report. The Sarkaz who makes the earth dance.
I, too, am not your enemy.

attributes.content: The fog... cleared...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: —You’re not a Leithanien. You give off a very unusual feeling... and you’re so young...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Who are you?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.options: Only a Rhodes Island Operator... Only of a kind with you, a Sarkaz.
Call me Logos if you wish.

attributes.content: Bob, how have you been?
This letter is sent to you from the care of my new employer. I suppose sending a second letter without waiting for a reply might confuse things?
To tell the truth, the people I mentioned in my last letter may not have the chance to meet you again.
But there’s no need to mourn. They fought to protect innocent Infected. As Sarkaz mercenaries, they never thought they’d get to die so nobly.
Maybe death can’t be defined in terms of how noble it was. But the people who live on have no doubt in their minds. They died with honor.
We are not currently in Kazdel. For some reason or another, the moment we were about to make it, we looked back.
Maybe it was my hesitation that let so many of my people die. Or maybe their deaths were a reminder that fate follows as close as my shadow. None of us can escape it.
And so I decided to resist. Maybe I wanted to fight against every injustice in this world. Maybe I just wanted my friends to be able to live on.
I haven’t sorted it all out yet. But we must walk forward. Only then can I shoulder all my past wrongs. Only then can I let so many more people who need not die, live on.
Oh, before I forget. I’ve heard a few things about you here. From a girl named Grani.
I couldn’t find a home for my people like you did. I couldn’t hold a candle to you. That’s my shame.
Live on well, Bob. Maybe one day... far in the future, I’ll be able to see you and your people in Columbia.
